content: Which of the following aquifer properties has the greatest influence on the rate of groundwater flow, according to Darcy's Law?
Which of the following best describes the driving force behind groundwater flow, as described by Darcy's Law?

options.label: A
options.content: The volume of water stored in the aquifer

options.label: B
options.content: The difference in hydraulic head between two points in the aquifer

options.label: D
options.content: The specific yield of the aquifer material

content: An aquifer with a low hydraulic conductivity will generally have:

options.label: A
options.content: A high rate of groundwater flow

options.label: B
options.content: A low rate of groundwater flow

content: Which of the following geological formations is most likely to be an aquifer?

options.label: C
options.content: A layer of well-sorted gravel and sand

content: A geological formation that transmits water very slowly and is not a good source of groundwater is called a(n
What is the primary difference between an aquifer and an aquiclude?

options.label: A
options.content: Aquifers are always located deeper underground than aquicludes

options.label: B
options.content: Aquicludes store more water than aquifers

options.label: C
options.content: Aquifers transmit water readily, while aquicludes do not transmit water at all

options.label: D
options.content: Aquifers are made of sand and gravel, while aquicludes are made of clay

content: The height to which water will rise in a small-diameter tube due to surface tension and adhesive forces, just above the water table, describes which of the following?
Which type of aquifer is generally the most susceptible to surface contamination from sources like agricultural runoff or leaking underground storage tanks?

options.label: C
options.content: Fractured bedrock aquifer overlain by a thick clay layer

content: For developing a high-yield water well, which aquifer characteristic is most important to consider?
Which of the following aquifer types is most likely to produce artesian flow when a well is drilled into it?
In seismic area, which one of the following has most negative effect on the dam stability?

options.label: A
options.content: If the horizontal acceleration due to earthquake is acting to u/s towards empty reservoir

options.label: B
options.content: If the horizontal acceleration due to earthquake is acting to u/s towards full reservoir

options.label: C
options.content: If the vertical acceleration due to earthquake is acting upward to the dam body

content: Which one of the following is incorrect about the uplift pressure under a gravity dam?

options.label: A
options.content: If there is a gallery, uplift pressure distribution will be decreased

options.label: B
options.content: If there is no tail water, the uplift pressure distribution will be increased

options.label: C
options.content: Uplift pressure is always having zero distribution if there is tension crack under the dam

content: Which of the following is incorrect about the hydraulic structures?

options.label: A
options.content: Straight gravity dams resist some external forces by arch action

options.label: B
options.content: All Arch dams resist all forces including it weight by arch action transferring to the abutments

options.label: C
options.content: Embankment dams will fail by overturning

content: Which one is incorrect about foundation of dams?

options.label: A
options.content: We can construction high gravity dams on fine grain material foundations

options.label: B
options.content: Embankment dams are not suitable to construct on rock foundation as gravity dam cannot be constructed on coarse grained materials

options.label: C
options.content: Curtain grouting is used to strengthen carrying capacity of the foundation

content: Dam storage has different components and out lets

options.label: A
options.content: Dead storage is used to store water for the any further required purpose of the storage

options.label: B
options.content: Bottom outlet is used to withdraw water for our live storage

options.label: C
options.content: Live storage is the component which is used to store sediment

content: Which one is incorrect about the stability of concrete gravity dams?

options.label: A
options.content: For full reservoir if the resultant of all external forces passes outside the middle third, tension will develop at the toe

options.label: B
options.content: For empty reservoir if the resultant of all external forces passes outside the middle third to the heel direction, tension will develop at the toe

options.label: C
options.content: If the principal stress is less than the compressive strength of the concrete, the dam will fail due to crushing

content: Dam spillways can be classified based on their purpose such as main spillway, auxiliary spillway and emergency spillway

options.label: A
options.content: when the actual flood exceeds the design flood

options.label: B
options.content: when there is malfunctioning of the main dam outlets

options.label: C
options.content: when the gates of spillway are not working

options.label: D
options.content: when the actual flood does not exceed the design flood

content: If low height Arch dam with d/s face of nearly vertical is proposed to be constructed on river X with narrow gorge and steeply rises abutment, which type of spillway will be the most appropriate?
Which one of the following types of spillways is not usually recommended for high dams due to the structure’s instability problem?
Different energy dissipator measures that can be adopted at the toe of the spillway depends upon the relative positions of jump height curve (JHC

options.label: C
options.content: providing sloping apron above the river bed

options.label: D
options.content: providing sloping apron below the river bed

content: Which one of the following is not correctly matched?

options.label: A
options.content: Canal head regulator- used to separate floor levels of the under sluices and the main weir section

options.label: B
options.content: Divide wall- constructed at the head of a canal taking off

options.label: C
options.content: Fish ladder - constructed on the bed of the river, upstream of the head regulator

content: Which type of spillway is ideally suited for a very high dams in which the energy can’t be dissipated by a hydraulic jump or bucket?
Which type of spillway component is used to dissipate energy at the toe of the spillway?
Which one of the following is not a correct statement?

options.label: A
options.content: If tail water depth is either too small or too large for the formation of perfect hydraulic jump at the toe of the spillway, bucket type energy dissipator is not the only option that should be provided for the dissipation of high energy

options.label: B
options.content: The most effective energy dissipation in overflow spillway design is when the tail water rating curve (TWRC

options.label: C
options.content: The amount of energy dissipation in a hydraulic jump increases as the Froude number increases

options.label: D
options.content: The amount of energy dissipation in a hydraulic jump decreases as the Froude number increases

content: What will be the possible measures that should be adopted at the toe of an overflow spillway for the dissipation of energy for the case when the jump height curve is lying below the tail water rating curve for all discharges?

options.label: A
options.content: Providing secondary dam/weir/ d/s of the toe of the spillway

options.label: B
options.content: By providing a sloping apron above the river bed

options.label: C
options.content: By providing a sloping apron below the river bed

content: What is the main objective of irrigation engineering?

options.label: A
options.content: To remove excess water from fields

options.label: B
options.content: To supply water to crops for optimum growth

content: What is the duty of water in irrigation engineering?

options.label: A
options.content: The depth of water applied to crops

options.label: B
options.content: The volume of water required per unit area

content: Which factor has the most significant influence on crop water requirements?

options.label: C
options.content: Climate conditions (temperature, humidity, wind, and solar radiation

content: The total amount of water needed by a crop during its entire growing period is called:
What is the term for the sum of water lost by evaporation from soil and transpiration from plants?
Which of the following methods is commonly used to estimate crop water requirements?
What is the purpose of the crop coefficient (Kc

options.label: B
options.content: To account for variations in crop water use at different growth stages

content: If an irrigation canal supplies water at a discharge rate of 5 m³/s to a field of 100 hectares, how long will it take to provide 10 cm of water depth?
If the conveyance efficiency of a canal is 80% and the field requires 5000 m³ of water, how much water should be released from the canal?
If an irrigation canal is designed to irrigate 200 hectares with a duty of 1000 hectares per cumec, what is the required discharge?
What is the function of an 'escapes' structure in an irrigation canal system?

options.label: A
options.content: To drain excess water from the canal

options.label: B
options.content: To store water for emergency use

options.label: C
options.content: To increase the velocity of water flow

content: What is the term for the loss of water due to seepage and evaporation in an irrigation canal?
What type of soil water is available for plant uptake?
What is the term for the water content in the soil after excess gravitational water has drained?
What happens when soil reaches the permanent wilting point?

options.label: B
options.content: Plants can no longer extract water and wilt permanently

content: Which soil type generally has the highest water-holding capacity?
Which irrigation method helps conserve soil moisture most efficiently?
What is the movement of water from plant leaves to the atmosphere called?
Which factor affects the rate of transpiration in plants?
Which type of soil structure provides the best balance of water retention and drainage for plant growth?
What is the main advantage of a pressurized irrigation system?

options.label: A
options.content: Reduces water loss and increases efficiency

content: Sprinkler irrigation is best suited for which type of crops?

options.label: B
options.content: To remove excess water from the field

options.label: C
options.content: To increase the amount of irrigation water

content: Which type of drainage system involves underground pipes to remove excess water?
What is the main purpose of surface drainage?

options.label: C
options.content: To prevent waterlogging on the surface

content: Which type of drainage system is used in agricultural fields to remove excess water?

options.content: Velocity and depth remain constant along the channel

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.content: Depth changes but velocity remains constant

options.content: Both velocity and depth change along the channel

From GVF, on a mild slope (S0 <Sc
Form GVF, On a horizontal slope (S0 = 0
From GVF, the M3 profile occurs when:

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.content: The flow depth is greater than both normal and critical depth

options.label: C
options.content: The flow depth is less than normal depth and greater than critical depth

content: From GVF, the S2 profile occurs when:

options.label: A
options.content: The flow depth is greater than normal depth and less than critical depth

options.label: B
options.content: The flow depth is greater than both normal and critical depth

options.label: C
options.content: The flow depth is less than normal depth and greater than critical depth

content: From GVF, the C1 profile occurs when:

options.content: The flow depth is equal to normal depth and less than critical depth

content: Rapidly varied flow is characterized by:

options.label: B

Which of the following statements about dimensional analysis in fluid mechanics is true?

options.label: A
options.content: The Buckingham π theorem states that any physical phenomenon can be described using a maximum of three dimensionless parameters

options.label: B
options.content: Reynolds number is a dimensionless parameter that compares gravitational and inertial forces

options.label: C
options.content: For model testing to be valid, only geometric similarity needs to be satisfied

options.label: D
options.content: Dimensional analysis helps in reducing the number of variables in a problem by grouping them into dimensionless numbers, aiding in model testing and similitude

content: Which of the following is correct about the four types of pipe flow problems and their solutions?

options.label: A
options.content: If flow rate and pipe-diameter is known, the head loss can be calculated using the Darcy-Weisbach equation

options.label: B
options.content: If head loss is known, the discharge is found using the Darcy-Weisbach equation without any iterations

options.label: C
options.content: If head loss is known, the pipe diameter can be determined without iterations

options.label: D
options.content: Given flow rate, the pipe length is found using Bernoulli’s equation assuming negligible friction

content: Which of the following statements correctly describes fundamental principles of pipe networks?

options.label: A
options.content: The Hardy Cross method is used to analyze open-channel networks by solving for flow depth variations along the system

options.label: B
options.content: In a series pipe connection, the total flow rate is the sum of the flow rates in each pipe, while in parallel pipe systems, the head loss is the sum of individual head losses

options.label: C
options.content: Modern hydraulic software has replaced traditional pipe network analysis methods, making fundamental principles like conservation of mass and energy outdated

options.label: D
options.content: In a pipe network, flow is always conserved at junctions (nodes

content: Which of the following statements correctly describes a fundamental property of fluids?

options.label: A
options.content: Viscosity is a measure of a fluid’s resistance to compression and it is constant for all fluids at different temperatures

options.label: B
options.content: A fluid is defined as a substance that deforms continuously under the application of a shear stress, no matter how small the shear force is

options.label: C
options.content: Surface tension is caused by cohesive forces between fluid molecules and has no effect on small-scale fluid motion such as bubble and water droplet formations

options.label: D
options.content: Density of a gas remains constant regardless of changes in pressure and temperature

content: Which of the following statements correctly describes a fundamental principle of fluid mechanics?

options.label: A
options.content: The principle of conservation of mass states that the velocity of a fluid must remain constant along a streamline

options.label: B
options.content: Bernoulli’s equation is derived from the energy equation with the assumption that the fluid flow is compressible, viscous, and unsteady

options.label: C
options.content: Euler’s equation describes the balance of forces in an inviscid (not-viscous

options.label: D
options.content: Flow visualization techniques, such as streamlines, path lines, and streak lines, are only applicable to steady flows

content: Which of the following statements correctly describes fundamental concepts related to pipe flow?

options.label: A
options.content: Friction head loss in pipe flow is caused by the interaction between the fluid and the pipe wall, and it is accounted for using a factor in the Darcy-Weisbach equation

options.label: B
options.content: Pipes are circular in cross-section to minimizes costs rather than for hydraulic advantages

options.label: C
options.content: In pipe flow, the hydraulic gradient is always equal to the pressure gradient, regardless of flow velocity or pepe roughness effects

options.label: D
options.content: The Manning equation is commonly used to calculate head losses in pressurized pipe systems

content: When rain starts falling, it strikes the buildings and different objects and gets collected there

What is the formula of excess or effective rainfall?

options.label: A
options.content: Excess rainfall = Total rainfall – Interception – Depression storage – Infiltration

options.label: C
options.content: Excess rainfall = Total rainfall – Interception – Depression storage

options.label: D
options.content: Excess rainfall = Total rainfall – Interception – Infiltration

content: What is initial basin loss?

options.label: A
options.content: Sum of infiltration and depression storage

options.label: D
options.content: Sum of rainfall interception and depression storage

options.label: B

options.content: It is too deep to extract water

options.label: D

content: What is an impounding reservoir?

options.label: B
options.content: A natural lake used for water supply

options.label: C
options.content: A pool formed upstream of a dam

content: Which of the following is a characteristic of groundwater?

options.label: A
options.content: A spring where water flows due to underground pressure in a confined aquifer

options.label: B
options.content: A spring that appears only in rainy seasons

options.label: C
options.content: A spring that forms in dry desert regions

options.label: D
options.content: A spring that requires a pump to extract water

content: What is a disadvantage of groundwater?

options.label: C
options.content: It often has high mineral content

options.label: D
options.content: It requires extensive sedimentation before use

content: What is the primary factor for selecting a water source for a town?

options.label: A
options.content: To collect water directly from rainfall

options.label: B
options.content: To filter water before reaching the consumer

options.label: C
options.content: To collect groundwater by horizontal perforated pipes

options.label: D
options.content: To store water in a reservoir

content: Which type of pipe is most resistant to corrosion?
Which of the following the most economical shape for a service reservoir?
What is the purpose of aeration in water treatment?

options.label: C
options.content: To remove dissolved gases like CO₂ and H₂S

content: What is the major disadvantage of an intermittent water supply system?

options.label: A
options.content: Continuous water loss due to leakage

options.label: C
